annotation.spannedText: The influenza vaccine is effective in preventing disease and death

classMention.mentionClass: The influenza vaccine is effective in preventing disease and death

annotation.spannedText: influenza vaccine is the most effective preventive measure available

annotation.spannedText: the World Health Organization

classMention.mentionClass: the World Health Organization

annotation.spannedText: Vaccination and the use of antiviral drugs are two of the most important response measures for reducing morbidity and mortality during a pandemic

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccination and the use of antiviral drugs are two of the most important response measures for reducing morbidity and mortality during a pandemic

annotation.spannedText: (WHO 2005d)

classMention.mentionClass: (WHO 2005d)

annotation.spannedText: The advantages of a live virus vaccine applied to the nasal mucosa are the development of local neutralising immunity, the development of a cell-mediated immune response, and a cross-reactive and longer lasting immune response

classMention.mentionClass: The advantages of a live virus vaccine applied to the nasal mucosa are the development of local neutralising immunity, the development of a cell-mediated immune response, and a cross-reactive and longer lasting immune response

annotation.spannedText: (Couch 1997)

classMention.mentionClass: (Couch 1997)

annotation.spannedText: Vaccination of caregivers against influenza also reduces the exposure of vulnerable populations to influenza

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccination of caregivers against influenza also reduces the exposure of vulnerable populations to influenza

annotation.spannedText: while individual health benefits from vaccination certainly exist, as do reductions in days absent from work, vaccinating healthy working adults may not provide cost savings when compared to loss of productivity and days taken off due to illness

classMention.mentionClass: while individual health benefits from vaccination certainly exist, as do reductions in days absent from work, vaccinating healthy working adults may not provide cost savings when compared to loss of productivity and days taken off due to illness

annotation.spannedText: Studies

classMention.mentionClass: Studies

annotation.spannedText: Vaccinating health care professionals is recommended, not only because of health benefits and reduced days absent from work, but because it is believed that hospital employees tend to report to work in spite of having an acute febrile illness

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccinating health care professionals is recommended, not only because of health benefits and reduced days absent from work, but because it is believed that hospital employees tend to report to work in spite of having an acute febrile illness

annotation.spannedText: vaccinating health care professionals reduces nursing home and hospital-acquired influenza infections

classMention.mentionClass: vaccinating health care professionals reduces nursing home and hospital-acquired influenza infections

annotation.spannedText: Previous studies

classMention.mentionClass: Previous studies

annotation.spannedText: This vaccine will not protect against avian influenza strains, but will help prevent dual infection, if infection with avian influenza does occur, thereby reducing opportunities for reassortment of two strains in one human host

classMention.mentionClass: This vaccine will not protect against avian influenza strains, but will help prevent dual infection, if infection with avian influenza does occur, thereby reducing opportunities for reassortment of two strains in one human host

annotation.spannedText: Caution should be used when giving the vaccine to those who may come into contact with immunocompromised patients, as this caused controversy in 2004 when vaccine supplies were limited

annotation.spannedText: (Manion 2005)

classMention.mentionClass: (Manion 2005)

annotation.spannedText: Both studies conclude that inadvertent vaccination or exposure to the attenuated virus is unlikely to result in significant adverse effects

annotation.spannedText: extreme caution should be exercised

annotation.spannedText: not clear yet, is the dose-response relationship between intramuscular and intradermal routes

classMention.mentionClass: (Kilbourne 2005)

annotation.spannedText: One drawback is that the local reactions can be more intense, with increased pain, swelling, and redness; however, these are still mild

classMention.mentionClass: One drawback is that the local reactions can be more intense, with increased pain, swelling, and redness; however, these are still mild

annotation.spannedText: vaccination against influenza is a crucial weapon, not only in our fight against seasonal influenza, but against a pandemic that may come tomorrow, next year, or in the next decade

classMention.mentionClass: vaccination against influenza is a crucial weapon, not only in our fight against seasonal influenza, but against a pandemic that may come tomorrow, next year, or in the next decade

annotation.spannedText: We need to prepare ourselves now

classMention.mentionClass: We need to prepare ourselves now

annotation.spannedText: it is likely that we will look back on our current influenza vaccines and think of them as primitive

classMention.mentionClass: it is likely that we will look back on our current influenza vaccines and think of them as primitive

annotation.spannedText: Details and advances noted now will be outdated tomorrow

classMention.mentionClass: Details and advances noted now will be outdated tomorrow

annotation.spannedText: A matching vaccine will require knowledge of the pandemic strain, and until the next pandemic begins, we will not know for certain what that strain will be

classMention.mentionClass: A matching vaccine will require knowledge of the pandemic strain, and until the next pandemic begins, we will not know for certain what that strain will be

annotation.spannedText: The important aspect is the development of established vaccines that do not need lengthy studies before they can enter the market

classMention.mentionClass: The important aspect is the development of established vaccines that do not need lengthy studies before they can enter the market

annotation.spannedText: This same system needs to be in place for a pandemic vaccine

classMention.mentionClass: This same system needs to be in place for a pandemic vaccine

annotation.spannedText: If the pandemic starts in a year's time, it is likely that we will then have some experience in developing mock vaccines, so that a vaccine could be produced relatively quickly using a variety of the technologies currently under investigation

classMention.mentionClass: If the pandemic starts in a year's time, it is likely that we will then have some experience in developing mock vaccines, so that a vaccine could be produced relatively quickly using a variety of the technologies currently under investigation

annotation.spannedText: There would still be a significant delay, and it is likely that there would still be insufficient quantities, with rationing required

classMention.mentionClass: There would still be a significant delay, and it is likely that there would still be insufficient quantities, with rationing required

annotation.spannedText: We don't know when a pandemic will occur - but starting preparation now is essential

classMention.mentionClass: We don't know when a pandemic will occur - but starting preparation now is essential

annotation.spannedText: The WHO also needs to lead the address of the problems of production capacity, legislation and expedited vaccine availability, and research that needs to be done in order to reach the point where these are possible

classMention.mentionClass: The WHO also needs to lead the address of the problems of production capacity, legislation and expedited vaccine availability, and research that needs to be done in order to reach the point where these are possible

annotation.spannedText: It needs to help solve the controversies over financing, patents and intellectual property, equity for developing countries and countries not producing vaccine, and rationing of vaccine when supplies do not meet the demands of a population of more than 6 billion people

classMention.mentionClass: It needs to help solve the controversies over financing, patents and intellectual property, equity for developing countries and countries not producing vaccine, and rationing of vaccine when supplies do not meet the demands of a population of more than 6 billion people

annotation.spannedText: Several countries have legislation that limits and/or covers certain liability for vaccine companies - encouraging such legislation will make vaccine companies feel more free to develop new vaccines, and increase the supply of current vaccines

classMention.mentionClass: Several countries have legislation that limits and/or covers certain liability for vaccine companies - encouraging such legislation will make vaccine companies feel more free to develop new vaccines, and increase the supply of current vaccines

annotation.spannedText: When the time comes for rapid entry of pandemic vaccines into general use, such legislation will be important

classMention.mentionClass: When the time comes for rapid entry of pandemic vaccines into general use, such legislation will be important

annotation.spannedText: Our goal should be to develop a new cell culture-based vaccine that includes antigens that are present in all subtypes of influenza virus, that do not change from year to year, and that can be made available to the entire world population

classMention.mentionClass: Our goal should be to develop a new cell culture-based vaccine that includes antigens that are present in all subtypes of influenza virus, that do not change from year to year, and that can be made available to the entire world population

annotation.spannedText: We need an international approach to public funding that will pay for the excess production capacity required during a pandemic
